file_content.text: You must be the Republic reinforcements. Too little, too late, if you ask me.
We can stop this outbreak if we work together.
Don't give up.
Work together? There's a novel concept. The nobles around here only care about themselves.
If it wasn't for us, rakghouls would be snacking on your intestines right now!
We saved your life!
You only postponed the inevitable. Nobody's getting off this world alive.
The nobles pretty much proved that. Stole a shuttle, tried to break the quarantine, and look where it got them.
It's not our fault. The Republic couldn't do anything until your government gave us clearance to land.
We had to wait for clearance.
Sounds about right. The nobles only care about themselves.
They decide the quarantine doesn't apply to them, so they raid the spaceport and steal a shuttle. Now my whole team is dead.
Never should have come to investigate the crash site. Should've known any survivors would already be infected.
If you were wounded in the battle, the virus could be in your system.
You could be infected, too.
Thanks for the reminder. Like things aren't bad enough. This plague's spiraling out of control.
The crash was obviously caused by a rakghoul on board the shuttle. You should have been expecting an attack.
Yep. That was pretty stupid.
Thought we could handle it. But these things are getting stronger. The plague's spiraling out of control.
I need a status report, Major.
In a word: hopeless. The plague's spiraling out of control. The rakghouls are getting stronger.
The virus isn't just infecting sentients anymore. It's spreading through the local wildlife. My patrols have no idea how to handle it.
Your patrols don't stand a chance against the rakghouls. I do.
That's why I'm here.
You want to take them on, be my guest. But I'm not leaving my troops out here to die.
No creature is unstoppable. If we can identify their vulnerabilities, we can defeat them.
They must have a weakness.
Yeah. Maybe you're right. We need to go look for answers.
The rakghouls have you running scared. We need to take the fight to them if we want to get the upper hand.
We need to take the offensive.
Yeah. Maybe you're right. We need to regroup and go on the attack!
Sure, the whole planet is being transformed into hideous mutants. But at least... uh... okay, I got nothing.
Don't be such a pessimist.
Thanks. Very reassuring. Things may be grim, but I'm not leaving my people out here to die.
Your brilliant plan of getting your team slaughtered didn't seem to work too well.
Maybe you're a bad leader.
You want to take over, be my guest. But I'm not leaving my troops out here to die.
It's too dangerous out here in the wilds. Tell your patrols to fall back somewhere safe.
Get them somewhere safe.
"Safe" doesn't really apply. But I'll give the order.
All patrols fall back to the spaceport. Stay on this frequency and keep in touch.
The spaceport's where the outbreak began. Maybe we can learn... ungh! My chest is on fire! Ahh!
The virus is inside you. We have to act fast.
We have to get you some help.
What's wrong, Major?
Are you okay?
You're infected, Major. Any second now you'll transform and try to rip my throat out.
This can't end well.
Great. You're infected. Guess I'll have to find someone else to show me around this planet.
Who didn't see this coming?
Don't let it end like this! Ngh! Please--help me!
I'm sorry. It's too late. There's nothing I can do.
[Let him live]
Yeah, there is. Ungh. Find out who's behind this and kill 'em for me! Argh!
Better to end your misery now.
[Kill him]
Just make it quick!
Those things would've torn me to pieces. You saved my life.
Never thought I'd be glad to see the Empire on Kaon.
Insult me again and you'll wish the rakghouls had finished you off.
I don't like your tone.
Not trying to insult you. But your kind isn't too popular in the hegemony.
Don't let your prejudices blind you to the benefits the Empire can bring you.
We can be a valuable ally.
Those prejudices run pretty deep here on Kaon.
I just work for the highest bidder.
I'm not part of the Empire.
Fair enough. But you gotta expect to be judged by the company you keep.
Never say never. It limits your options.
Life is full of surprises.
Some options are less acceptable than others.
Just say the word and you can fend for yourself.
We could leave.
That's not my call. The royal family authorized your presence here. None of us ordinary folk had a say.
Don't let your prejudices blind you. You can't stop the rakghouls alone.
We're here to help.
I want to believe that. But you gotta expect a little suspicion, given your reputation.
Truth be told, a lot of people on Kaon actually blame the Empire for this outbreak.
They figure an infected ship was intentionally sent here to destabilize the system.
If the Empire was behind this, why would they send anyone to help?
That makes no sense.
Maybe they want you to look like heroes. Save the planet, then try to convince the hegemony to join the Empire.
What kind of evidence do you have? Or are you just throwing around wild theories?
Any proof of this?
I'm just telling you what I heard. Doesn't seem that far-fetched, though.
Do you believe the Empire caused this?
What do you think?
The Empire's done far worse in its day. But if you're not responsible, there's one way to prove it.
Checking the records at the spaceport will show where the infected ship came from. Should tell us who's behind this, one way or another.
That should have been the first thing you did.
You didn't check that already?
Our first priority was enforcing the quarantine. Couldn't let this spread. But I've got patrols headed to the spaceport now.
I'm not walking into a trap. You're coming with me to the spaceport.
I don't trust you.
Fair enough. Already told my people to fall back there. Figured I'd warn you so you didn't think it was an ambush.
We should go there now.
Already ordered the other patrols to meet us there. They'll give us regular status updates.
Maybe we'll get lucky and find someth--ungh! My chest is on fire! Argh!
No! It was just a scratch... ungh! One scratch can't turn me into... ungh! Please--do something!
This should be interesting.
[Let him suffer]
Ungh! I always knew you were... ungh... scum!
It's too late for you. There's only one solution.
[End his suffering]
